page.title: 12THE SINGLE PARENT
page.content: At one time , being a single parent in a small village was very difficult. People had such funny attitudes to divorce. Although old fashioned ideas tend to linger in villages, I do not find any major problems around here. Perhaps it is because we are so close to Cardiff that people have a much more liberal outlook. I find that people are genuinely helpful and concerned. Having a young child, I am unable to work until she goes to school so life is not easy. There is not much money to spare. I am grateful for my neighbours. If I am not well, they will do all they can to help and they often care for Julie for me to have a break.
